title: Encode Child Tax Credit (26 USC ยง24)

Implement statute-organized parameter structure
description:
Currently the DSL agent hardcodes parameter values in match expressions. Per the DSL spec, parameters should be:

1. Stored in YAML files at paths mirroring statute structure (e.g., rules/us/federal/irs/credits/eitc.yaml)
2. Referenced by path in formulas: parameter(gov.irs.eitc.phase_in_rate[n_children])
3. Support indexed lookups for parameterized values

Tasks:
- [ ] Create parameter YAML schema and loader
- [ ] Update agent prompt to generate parameter references instead of hardcoded values  
- [ ] Update executor to resolve parameter paths from YAML files
- [ ] Migrate existing test parameters to YAML structure

title: Fix lexer to handle statute paths with numeric segments
description:
The lexer parses '26.32' as a float, breaking statute paths like 'module statute.26.32.a.1'.

Error:
```
parse_file('statute/26/32/a/1/earned_income_credit.cosilico')
ValueError: could not convert string to float: '26.32.'
```

Need to distinguish numeric literals from path segments in module/reference contexts.

title: Implement inflation indexing with precedence tiers
description:
Design and implement proper inflation indexing:

1. Parameters declare which statute section defines their indexing (e.g., ยง32(j))
2. Indexing rules specify: base year, index (CPI-U, C-CPI-U), rounding
3. Three-tier precedence: published > projected > calculated
4. Separate historical vs forecast index values conceptually
5. Support projecting future values when official values unavailable

Key insight: The agent should understand indexing rules from statute and apply them correctly, not just copy hardcoded values.
